result.execSummary:
The defendant Gairitt G Schad was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Consec to 14CF2085.  Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.  Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
1/22/16 JOC corrected to reflect that the judge ordered the def eligible for CIP at time of sentencing. All other conditions remain the same.

superMiscConds.notes: DA has 90 days to prepare/submit order.  To be collected by the Department of Corrections.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.  The balance remaining at release from prison be paid as a condition of extended supervision or parole at a rate determined by the supervising agent.
$250 DNA surcharge remitted. $268  to be paid by the defendant to the Clerk of Courts office within 60 days.

Pay supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Defendant shall complete a risk and needs assessment and comply with care plan goals related to prioritized need areas identified.  Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample.  Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.

records.descr: Petition for sentence adjust denied-public interst

records.addlTxt: This Petition for Sentence Adjustment is DENIED because it is not in the public interest.  Mr. Schad has not presented any evidence of positive institutional adjustment.  No records of treatment, employment, etc. have been presented.  The Court cannot rely on his own statements as proof that he has earned the privilege of sentence adjustment.
DA response due by February 10, 2022

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release.
- Defendant shall complete the booking/fingerprinting process prior to release.
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Greg H.
- Defendant shall not possess any type of dangerous weapon.
- Defendant shall not be in the front seat of any motor vehicle.
- Defendant shall take any prescribed mental health medication as prescribed.
- Defendant shall not be in possession of any ammunition.
- Defnedant shall not be in possession of any BB guns, facsimile firearms or air guns.
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with any known gang member.
Defendant waived the time limits for Preliminary Hearing.

Court entered not guilty plea as to any misdemeanor counts.  Status conference scheduled for April 13, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
